snippet: A judge rejected arguments that Troy Folk, 18, deserved a lesser sentence because of his age.
abstract: Justice Edward J McLaughlin of State Supreme Court in Manhattan rejects request from Harlem woman who was shot in the stomach by teenager Troy Folk to show leniency in his sentencing; also rejects argument from Folk's lawyer, who said Folk deserved leniency because of his age, and issues a sentence of 18 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A judge rejected arguments that Troy Folk, 18, deserved a lesser sentence because of his age.

headline.seo: Troy Folk, 18, Sentenced to 18 Years in Shooting of Harlem Woman
headline.main: Judge Rejects Victim’s Plea and Sentences Teenager to 18 Years in Shooting
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Victim’s Plea and Sentences Teenager to 18 Years in Shooting
